titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Defendant Greer's motion for an extension of time 14 is granted. The defendant is given until on or before April 30, 2008, in which to file pretrial motions pursuant to the progression order. The time between April 16, 2008 and April 30, 2008, shall be excluded under the Speedy Trial Act as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. ( KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - Defendant Greer's motion for an extension of time 14 is granted. The defendant is given until on or before April 30, 2008, in which to file pretrial motions pursuant to the progression order. The time between April 16, 2008 and April 30, 2008, shall be excluded under the Speedy Trial Act as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. ( KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION - IT IS RECOMMENDED to the Honorable Joseph F. Bataillon, Chief United States District Judge, that the motion to suppress 19 be denied in all respects. ORDER that the clerk shall cause an expedited transcript of the hearing to be prepared and filed. Any objection to this Report and Recommendation shall be filed within ten (10) business days after the transcript is available to counsel for reading in the clerk's office. Failure to timely object may constitute a waiver of any such objection. The brief in support of any objection shall be filed at the time of filing such objection. Failure to file a brief in support of any objection may be deemed an abandonment of the objection as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION - IT IS RECOMMENDED to the Honorable Joseph F. Bataillon, Chief United States District Judge, that the motion to suppress 19 be denied in all respects. ORDER that the clerk shall cause an expedited transcript of the hearing to be prepared and filed. Any objection to this Report and Recommendation shall be filed within ten (10) business days after the transcript is available to counsel for reading in the clerk's office. Failure to timely object may constitute a waiver of any such objection. The brief in support of any objection shall be filed at the time of filing such objection. Failure to file a brief in support of any objection may be deemed an abandonment of the objection as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 49 Motion to Continue Trial as to James Edward Greer (1). Jury Trial set for 9/29/2008 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 3 - Omaha before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. The time between August 28, 2008 and September 29, 2008 shall be deemed excludable. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. ( JLS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 49 Motion to Continue Trial as to James Edward Greer (1). Jury Trial set for 9/29/2008 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 3 - Omaha before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. The time between August 28, 2008 and September 29, 2008 shall be deemed excludable. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. ( JLS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 81 Motion for Preliminary Forfeiture as to James Edward Greer (1); Based upon Count II of the Indictment and the guilty verdict, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the.38 caliber Taurus revolver, serial number HA 94303 and shall publish notice that any person, other than the Defendant, having or claiming a legal interest in any of the subject forfeited property must file a Petition with the court within thirty days of the final publication of notice or of receipt of actual notice, whichever is earlier. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( ADB, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 81 Motion for Preliminary Forfeiture as to James Edward Greer (1); Based upon Count II of the Indictment and the guilty verdict, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the.38 caliber Taurus revolver, serial number HA 94303 and shall publish notice that any person, other than the Defendant, having or claiming a legal interest in any of the subject forfeited property must file a Petition with the court within thirty days of the final publication of notice or of receipt of actual notice, whichever is earlier. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( ADB, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 91 Motion for Final Forfeiture as to James Edward Greer (1); All right, title and interest in and to the.38 caliber Taurus revolver, serial number HA 94303, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( ADB, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 91 Motion for Final Forfeiture as to James Edward Greer (1); All right, title and interest in and to the.38 caliber Taurus revolver, serial number HA 94303, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( ADB, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to James Edward Greer (1). The defendant was found guilty on count 1 of the indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 188 months; defendant shall be given credit for time served; 5 years supervised release with special conditions; and $100 special assessment. Final order of forfeiture was filed on 12/16/08 as to count 2 as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 Certified copies to USM) (JSF)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to James Edward Greer (1). The defendant was found guilty on count 1 of the indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 188 months; defendant shall be given credit for time served; 5 years supervised release with special conditions; and $100 special assessment. Final order of forfeiture was filed on 12/16/08 as to count 2 as to defendant James Edward Greer. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 Certified copies to USM) (JSF)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to James Edward Greer. On initial review, the court finds that summary dismissal is not appropriate. The United States shall file an answer to the defendant's ยง 2255 motion (Filing No. 123) within 21 days of the date of this order. Defendant's motion to leave to proceed in forma pauperis (Filing No. 124) is granted. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party)(GJG)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to James Edward Greer. On initial review, the court finds that summary dismissal is not appropriate. titleInfo.title: USA v. Greer
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Former defense counsel, Shannon P. O'Connor, is hereby requested to file an affidavit in this case, addressing all pertinent information that he believes is reasonably necessary to respond to the defendant's ineffective-assistance-of-counsel claims against him, if he so chooses, and shall do so within 30 days from the date of this order. The defendant has waived the attorney-client privilege with respect to the matters raised in his ineffective-assistance-of-counsel claims in his motion filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 as to defendant James Edward Greer. The Clerk of Court is ordered to serve a copy of this order on previous defense counsel, Shannon P. O'Connor. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copies mailed to defendant and as directed) (AOA)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - Former defense counsel, Shannon P. O'Connor, is hereby requested to file an affidavit in this case, addressing all pertinent information that he believes is reasonably necessary to respond to the defendant's ineffective-assistance-of-counsel claims against him, if he so chooses, and shall do so within 30 days from the date of this order. The defendant has waived the attorney-client privilege with respect to the matters raised in his ineffective-assistance-of-counsel claims in his motion filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 as to defendant James Edward Greer. The Clerk of Court is ordered to serve a copy of this order on previous defense counsel, Shannon P. O'Connor. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copies mailed to defendant and as directed) (AOA)
